definition: to hear (sth said)/one hears (that)/hearsay/listening and speaking
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
variant of 說|说[shuo1]

sentences.english: Andrew's face fell when he was told he couldn' t go on the trip.
sentences.chinese: 安德鲁听说他不能去旅游时脸沉了下来。

sentences.english: As for whether he will visit the DPRK, I am not aware of such an arrangement.
sentences.chinese: 至于他是否去朝鲜，目前我没有听说有这方面的安排。

sentences.english: And I heard it helps to have funding in advance too.
sentences.chinese: 而且我听说这也有助于提前得到资助。

sentences.english: Good ability for listening , speaking , reading and writing english.
sentences.chinese: 良好的英语听说读写能力为佳。

sentences.english: I heard that when a group of girls tried to escape, they locked them in the rooms and beat them up.
sentences.chinese: 我听说有一群女孩试着逃走，被他们锁在屋子里狠揍。

sentences.english: Upon my word, I've never heard of such a thing.
sentences.chinese: 说实在话，我从未听说过这种事情。

sentences.english: Have you heard of rocket scientist Sun Jiadong?
sentences.chinese: 你听说过火箭科学家孙家栋吗？

sentences.english: You heard Dr. turtle scratch-free car wash do?
sentences.chinese: 您听说过龟博士的免划痕洗车吗？

sentences.english: We have only hearsay for that.
The young author burned energy as if he never heard of resting.
sentences.chinese: 这位青年作家耗费精力，似乎从未听说过休息。

sentences.english: We’ve all heard about the Earth’s temperature rising at an alarming rate.
sentences.chinese: 我们都听说了地球的温度在以令人担忧的速度上升。

sentences.english: I have never eaten it, even heard it.
sentences.chinese: 我从来没吃过它甚至连听都没听说过。

sentences.english: In fact, we heard that kid is right here in the jungle.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，我们听说那个孩子就正好在森林里。

sentences.english: And I hear it gets even more complicated once they’re smoked.
sentences.chinese: 而我听说一旦被熏烤之后情况就更复杂。

sentences.english: I'm A-Ok. I heard that you are visiting NYC next month, why?
sentences.chinese: 我还行。听说你下个月要去纽约了，为什么？

sentences.english: Tracy: Oh, I've heard of it.

definition: it is said that/reportedly
a few days before
but/however/(used for emphasis) indeed
Correct!/Oh, that's right, ... (when one suddenly remembers sth one wanted to mention)/Oh, by the way, ...
It is said that ... (at the start of a narrative)/to discuss/to recount
sentence-final particle (abbr. for 呢啊[ne5 a5] or variant of 哪[na5])
battle cry
(question particle for "yes-no" questions)
see 嗎啡|吗啡, morphine
(particle equivalent to 啊 after a vowel, expressing surprise or doubt)
modal particle indicating that sth is obvious/particle indicating a pause for emphasis
interjection or grunt of agreement/uhm/Ah, OK/expression of recognition/Oh, it's you!
modal particle ending sentence, showing affirmation, approval, or consent
interjection of surprise/Ah!/Oh!
interjection expressing doubt or requiring answer/Eh?/what?
interjection of surprise or doubt/Eh?/My!/what's up?
over there/yonder
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
youngest/most junior/tiny/one (unambiguous spoken form when spelling out numbers, esp. on telephone or in military)/one or ace on dice or dominoes/variant of 吆[yao1], to shout
surname Yao
to find out/to know/to learn about
it may be assumed that
recently
